item.title: Retaining the biofilm
item.description: TLDR: Should you retain the biofilm? # It isn’t required, but it won’t hurt anything. What is the biofilm? # Sometimes called the pellicle or the SCOBY, the biofilm is one of the things that really make kombucha stand out. It is the rubbery disk that develops during fermentation. Some are adamant that it must be kept from batch to batch, going so far as to wash and cut it down.

item.title: Terminology
item.description: Terminology # Why be specific # Kombucha brewing has a great deal of associated mythology. While this provides some interesting reading and makes the brewing process feel magical, it can sometimes make it difficult for new brewers to understand what they are reading online (at least it did for me). Written communication only really works if we all understand what specific terms mean. This is doubly true for something like a recipe, since the writer is attempting to convey specific instructions.
